ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Symmetrical hearing loss sloping from mild/moderate to profound, likely of genetic etiology, with significant functional deficits in noise.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess unaided word recognition ability.
To assess aided sentence recognition in quiet (initial standard protocol).
To assess aided speech recognition using more ecologically valid stimuli (AzBio, CNC, BKB-SIN) for CI candidacy.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrated bilateral symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss. While initial aided testing with HINT sentences in quiet yielded high scores (69-88%) that technically exceeded FDA candidacy criteria, further evaluation with the revised MSTB (AzBio, CNC, BKB-SIN) revealed significant deficits in speech understanding and severe SNR loss. These more rigorous measures confirmed the patient was a candidate for cochlear implantation.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical SNHL; Right mild sloping to profound, Left moderate sloping to profound. No measurable hearing >3 kHz (Right) or >2 kHz (Left).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Unaided NU-6 WRS at 85 dB HL: 36% Right, 28% Left.

tests.name: Speech audiometry (HINT)
tests.result_summary: Aided in quiet: 69% Right, 64% Left, 88% Bilateral. Scores suggested non-candidacy due to ceiling effects.

tests.name: Speech audiometry (MSTB Revised)
tests.result_summary: Aided AzBio in quiet: 45% Right, 36% Left, 54% Bilateral. Aided CNC Words: 20% Right, 0% Left, 4% Bilateral. Aided CNC Phonemes: 47% Right, 21% Left, 33% Bilateral.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise (BKB-SIN)
tests.result_summary: Aided SNR Loss: 20 dB Right (Severe), 22 dB Left (Severe), 17 dB Bilateral (Severe).

proposed_items: Bimodal listening (CI on Right, HA on Left)
counseling_actions: Explain the discrepancy between HINT scores (ceiling effect) and MSTB results (demonstrating true difficulty)
Discuss CI candidacy based on the more rigorous MSTB testing
Recommend Right ear for implantation due to history of Left facial paralysis
Counsel on the benefits of bimodal listening for speech in noise and music appreciation

escalation.rationale_short: Patient meets CI candidacy criteria based on revised MSTB testing.

follow_up_plan.objective: Activation of cochlear implant and assessment of speech recognition outcomes.

expected_outcome: Aided CNC Words (Post-op): Right 60%, Left 36%, Bimodal 88%.
Aided CNC Phonemes (Post-op): Right 79%, Left 64%, Bimodal 96%.
Aided AzBio in Quiet (Post-op): Right 97%, Left 42%, Bimodal 96%.
Aided BKB-SIN (Post-op): Right 12.5 dB (Moderate), Bimodal 5.5 dB (Mild).
Patient reported significant improvement in speech recognition in noise and continues to use FM system in complex environments.
